comments.body: Maybe I'm missing it, but don't we need to clear `cleaners`? Perhaps there should be a test assertion somewhere.
I'd have loved to replace `filthiest` with something better but I can't think of much. `cleanDirtyLog`, may be?

`filthiest` and `filthy` is used in multiple places to denote a dirty compacted log:
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/9f7267dd2fedde86bf15aabdbc5256e5fc617184/core/src/main/scala/kafka/log/LogCleanerManager.scala#L122
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/9f7267dd2fedde86bf15aabdbc5256e5fc617184/core/src/main/scala/kafka/log/LogCleanerManager.scala#L144

I think if we'd change the naming we'd need to change some of those occurrences as well. May I ask why you prefer dirty over filthiest? I see both as synonyms

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +307,311 @@      * @return whether a log was cleaned
      */
    private def cleanFilthiestLog(): Boolean = {
      var currentLog: Option[Log] = None
